intro: Clompanus thorelii, commonly known as the Thorelian clompanus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
